title: DuPont Fabros Technology Down 8.8% Since...
content:
DuPont Fabros Technology was downgraded from Outperform to Sector Perform by RBC Capital one week ago.  The stock closed at $25.08, which is 8.8% lower than the price one week ago ($27.50). 
 
DuPont Fabros Technology Inc. is a real estate investment trust and owner, developer, operator and manager of wholesale data centers.  The Company's data centers are used primarily by national and international technology companies to house, power and cool the computer servers that support many of their most critical business processes. 
 
In the past 52 weeks, shares of DuPont Fabros Technology have traded between a low of $24.88 and a high of $38.30 and are now at $24.99, which is 0% above that low price.  The 200-day and 50-day moving averages have moved 0.4% lower and 0.91% lower over the past week, respectively. 
 
DuPont Fabros Technology (NYSE:DFT) has potential upside of 44.6% based on a current price of $24.99 and analysts' consensus price target of $36.12.  The stock should run into initial resistance at its 50-day moving average (MA) of $28.17 and subsequent resistance at its 200-day MA of $31.5
